explanation:
The correct pattern subtracts 10 each term:  
23 - 10 = 13  
13 - 10 = 3  
3 - 10 = -7  

The student likely calculated the consistent difference (-10) between terms but misinterpreted this difference as the next term itself. This conflates the term-to-term operation with the actual sequence values. For example, they may have concluded "the rule is subtract 10" and directly reported "-10" as the next entry rather than applying the rule to the last term (3 - 10). This matches the misconception of identifying the rule instead of the next term, distinct from errors like using only the first two terms (which would still produce -7 if applied correctly).
